1.text: A Psalm of David. Blessed be the LORD my strength, which teacheth my hands to war, and my fingers to fight:

2.text: My goodness, and my fortress; my high tower, and my deliverer; my shield, and he in whom I trust; who subdueth my people under me.

3.text: LORD, what is man, that thou takest knowledge of him! or the son of man, that thou makest account of him!

4.text: Man is like to vanity: his days are as a shadow that passeth away.

5.text: Bow thy heavens, O LORD, and come down: touch the mountains, and they shall smoke.

6.text: Cast forth lightning, and scatter them: shoot out thine arrows, and destroy them.

7.text: Send thine hand from above; rid me, and deliver me out of great waters, from the hand of strange children;

8.text: Whose mouth speaketh vanity, and their right hand is a right hand of falsehood.

9.text: I will sing a new song unto thee, O God: upon a psaltery and an instrument of ten strings will I sing praises unto thee.

10.text: It is he that giveth salvation unto kings: who delivereth David his servant from the hurtful sword.

11.text: Rid me, and deliver me from the hand of strange children, whose mouth speaketh vanity, and their right hand is a right hand of falsehood:

12.text: That our sons may be as plants grown up in their youth; that our daughters may be as corner stones, polished after the similitude of a palace:

13.text: That our garners may be full, affording all manner of store: that our sheep may bring forth thousands and ten thousands in our streets:

14.text: That our oxen may be strong to labour; that there be no breaking in, nor going out; that there be no complaining in our streets.

15.text: Happy is that people, that is in such a case: yea, happy is that people, whose God is the LORD.
